intro: Gypsocallis lyrigera, commonly known as the Lyreleaf Gypsocallis, is a flowering plant native to the Andes mountains of South America. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its striking, lyre-shaped leaves. The plant produces showy, bell-shaped flowers in shades of white and pink, which bloom in the spring. It thrives in cool, humid environments and requires well-drained soil. Gypsocallis lyrigera is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and greenhouses.
